required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Confirmatory Clinical Trial of the Evera MRI System for Conditionally-safe MRI Access

lead_sponsor.agency: Medtronic Cardiac Rhythm and Heart Failure

clinical_study.source: Medtronic Cardiac Rhythm and Heart Failure

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the Evera MRI™ study is to confirm safety and efficacy of the Evera MRI ICD (Implantable cardioverter-defibrillator) System in the clinical MRI (Magnetic Resonance Imaging) environment when subjects receive MRI scans without positioning restrictions (MRI scans may occur anywhere on the body).

primary_outcome.description: Number of patients free of MRI-related events. Events include MRI-related complications, sustained tachyarrhythmia, and MRI-related loss of pacing ability.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-MRI/Waiting Period visit to 1-month post-MRI/Waiting Period visit
primary_outcome.description: Number of successful patients, where success is defined as not increasing VPCT by more than 0.5V from pre-MRI/waiting to one month post.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-MRI/Waiting Period visit to 1-month post-MRI/Waiting Period visit
primary_outcome.description: Number of successful patients who do not experience a decrease in ventricular sensing amplitude of >50% from the pre-MRI/waiting period to the one month post-MRI/waiting period, or a one month post-MRI/waiting value <3mV accompanied by a decrease of >25% from the pre-MRI/waiting period to the one month post-MRI/waiting period.

secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects free of a system-related complication. The system includes the ICD and lead(s) attached to it.
Number of subjects whose RV defibrillation impedance at the one-month post-MRI/waiting period visit is between 20 and 100 ohms
Number of subjects whose SVC defibrillation impedance at the one-month post-MRI/waiting period visit is between 20 and 100 ohms

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-MRI/Waiting Period visit to 1-month post-MRI/Waiting Period visit
secondary_outcome.description: Number of successful patients, where success is defined as not increasing APCT by more than 0.5V from pre-MRI/waiting to one month post.
Number of successful patients, where success is defined as not decreasing atrial sensing amplitude by more than 50% from pre-MRI/waiting to one month post.

arm_group.description: Subjects randomized to the MRI group will undergo a series of MRI scans at the MRI visit (9-12 weeks post-implant).
Subjects randomized to the Control group will wait for 1 hour without having a series of MRI scans at the waiting period visit (9-12 weeks post-implant).

intervention.intervention_name: MRI scan sequences of the head and chest regions

intervention.description: Waiting period time will equate to 1 hour

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who are indicated for implantation of an ICD at the time of study enrollment.
- Subjects who are able to undergo a pectoral implant.
- Subjects who are receiving an ICD for the first time.
- Subjects who are able and willing to undergo elective MRI scanning without sedation.
- Subjects who are geographically stable and available for follow-up at the study site for the length of the study.
- Subjects who are at least 18 years of age (or older, if required by local law).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with a history of significant tricuspid valvular disease .
- Subjects for whom a single dose of 1.0mg dexamethasone sodium phosphate and/or dexamethasone acetate may be contraindicated.
- Subjects who require a legally authorized representative to obtain informed consent.
- Subjects undergoing device upgrades, change-outs, lead extractions, and/or lead or device revisions.
- Subjects with abandoned or capped leads.
- Subjects who require an indicated MRI scan, other than those specifically described in the Evera MRI™ study, before the one-month post-MRI/waiting period follow-up (approximately 4 months post-implant).
- Subjects with a non-MRI compatible device (such as neurostimulators) or material implant (e.g., non-MRI compatible sternal wires, neurostimulators, biostimulators, metals or alloys).
- Subjects with medical conditions that preclude the testing required by the study protocol or limit study participation.
- Subjects who are enrolled or intend to participate in another clinical trial (of an investigational drug or device, new indication for an approved drug or device, or requirement of additional testing beyond standard clinical practice) during the Evera MRI™ study. Co-enrollment in concurrent trials is only allowed when documented pre-approval is obtained from the Medtronic study manager.
- Female patient who is pregnant, or of childbearing potential and not on a reliable form of birth control. Women of childbearing potential are required to have a negative pregnancy test within seven (7) days prior to device implant.
- Subjects with exclusion criteria required by local law (e.g., age, breastfeeding).

overall_official.affiliation: University of Pittsburgh Medical Center, USA
German Red Cross Hospital (DRK) Neuwied, Germany

facility.name: DLP Upper Michigan Cardiovascular Associates PC
University of North Carolina (UNC) Memorial Hospital

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 275 subjects were enrolled (consented) at 42 centers in the Evera MRI study. The first enrollment occurred on April 17, 2014, and the last enrollment occurred on September 11, 2014.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A successful implant was defined as having received a complete Evera MRI™ Study System (Evera MRI™ DR or VR ICD, one Model 6935M or 6947M lead, and one Model 5076 lead (if DR system)). Eleven subjects did not have an implant attempt and one subject did not have a successful implant. None of these subjects were randomized.

group.title: MRI Group
group.description: Subjects randomized to the MRI group will undergo a series of MRI scans at the MRI visit (9-12 weeks post-implant). MRI scan sequences of the head and chest regions: Non-diagnostic MRI scans

group.title: Control Group
group.description: Subjects randomized to the Control group will wait for 1 hour without having a series of MRI scans at the waiting period visit (9-12 weeks post-implant). Waiting Period Visit: Waiting period time will equate to 1 hour

participants_list.participants: Subjects randomized to the MRI group.
Subjects randomized to the Control group.
Subject followed up at least to the one-month post MRI/Waiting period visit in the MRI group.
Subject followed up at least to the one-month post MRI/Waiting period visit in the Control group.

group.title: MRI Group
group.description: Subjects randomized to the MRI group will undergo a series of MRI scans at the MRI visit (9-12 weeks post-implant). MRI scan sequences of the head and chest regions: Non-diagnostic MRI scans

group.title: Control Group
group.description: Subjects randomized to the Control group will wait for 1 hour without having a series of MRI scans at the waiting period visit (9-12 weeks post-implant). Waiting Period Visit: Waiting period time will equate to 1 hour

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: MRI-related Events
outcome.description: Number of patients free of MRI-related events. Events include MRI-related complications, sustained tachyarrhythmia, and MRI-related loss of pacing ability.
outcome.population: A total of 156 subjects underwent an MRI scan at the MRI/waiting period visit; of them 147 were followed through the one month post-MRI visit or later and are included in the analysis.

group.title: MRI Group
group.description: All subjects successfully implanted with the Evera MRI Study System who have an MRI scan at the MRI/waiting period visit and have completed their one month post-MRI scan follow-up, (or a later follow-up), or have had an MRI-related event without completion of their one-month post-MRI scan follow-up will be included in the analysis

measure.title: MRI-related Events
measure.description: Number of patients free of MRI-related events. Events include MRI-related complications, sustained tachyarrhythmia, and MRI-related loss of pacing ability.
measure.population: A total of 156 subjects underwent an MRI scan at the MRI/waiting period visit; of them 147 were followed through the one month post-MRI visit or later and are included in the analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: The alternative hypothesis is that the MRI-related event-free rate between the MRI procedure and one month post-MRI is greater than 90%. The null hypothesis will be rejected if the one-sided 97.5% lower confidence bound is greater than 90% or, equivalently, if the p-value is less than 0.025. Assuming type I error rate 0.025, even-free rate under null hypothesis 90% and true even-free rate 0.995, the minimum required sample size is 54 MRI scanned subjects in order to obtain 90% power.
analysis.p_value_desc: A priori threshold for statistical significance was 0.025.

outcome.title: Ventricular Pacing Capture Threshold (VPCT)
outcome.description: Number of successful patients, where success is defined as not increasing VPCT by more than 0.5V from pre-MRI/waiting to one month post.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-MRI/Waiting Period visit to 1-month post-MRI/Waiting Period visit
outcome.population: To be included in the analysis, subjects in the MRI group must undergo an MRI scan and those in the Control group must complete the MRI/waiting period visit, and all the subjects must have valid VPCT measurements pre-MRI/waiting period and post-MRI/waiting period.

group.title: MRI Group
group.description: Subjects randomized to the MRI group will undergo a series of MRI scans at the MRI visit (9-12 weeks post-implant). MRI scan sequences of the head and chest regions: Non-diagnostic MRI scans

group.title: Control Group
group.description: Subjects randomized to the Control group will wait for 1 hour without having a series of MRI scans at the waiting period visit (9-12 weeks post-implant). Waiting Period Visit: Waiting period time will equate to 1 hour

measure.title: Ventricular Pacing Capture Threshold (VPCT)
measure.description: Number of successful patients, where success is defined as not increasing VPCT by more than 0.5V from pre-MRI/waiting to one month post.
measure.population: To be included in the analysis, subjects in the MRI group must undergo an MRI scan and those in the Control group must complete the MRI/waiting period visit, and all the subjects must have valid VPCT measurements pre-MRI/waiting period and post-MRI/waiting period.

analysis.groups_desc: The percentage of subjects who experience a VPCT increase less than or equal to 0.5V from the pre-MRI/waiting period to one month post-MRI/waiting period in the MRI group is greater than that in the Control group minus 10%. H0: % successes MRI group ≤ % successes Control group – 10% HA: % successes MRI group > % successes Control group – 10%
analysis.p_value_desc: A priori threshold for statistical significance was 0.025.

outcome.title: Ventricular Sensing Amplitude (R-wave)
outcome.description: Number of successful patients who do not experience a decrease in ventricular sensing amplitude of >50% from the pre-MRI/waiting period to the one month post-MRI/waiting period, or a one month post-MRI/waiting value <3mV accompanied by a decrease of >25% from the pre-MRI/waiting period to the one month post-MRI/waiting period.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-MRI/Waiting Period visit to 1-month post-MRI/Waiting Period visit
outcome.population: Only subjects with measured ventricular sensing amplitude values both pre-MRI/waiting period and post-MRI/waiting period were used in the analysis.

group.title: MRI Group
group.description: Subjects randomized to the MRI group will undergo a series of MRI scans at the MRI visit (9-12 weeks post-implant). MRI scan sequences of the head and chest regions: Non-diagnostic MRI scans

group.title: Control Group
group.description: Subjects randomized to the Control group will wait for 1 hour without having a series of MRI scans at the waiting period visit (9-12 weeks post-implant). Waiting Period Visit: Waiting period time will equate to 1 hour

measure.title: Ventricular Sensing Amplitude (R-wave)
measure.description: Number of successful patients who do not experience a decrease in ventricular sensing amplitude of >50% from the pre-MRI/waiting period to the one month post-MRI/waiting period, or a one month post-MRI/waiting value <3mV accompanied by a decrease of >25% from the pre-MRI/waiting period to the one month post-MRI/waiting period.
measure.population: Only subjects with measured ventricular sensing amplitude values both pre-MRI/waiting period and post-MRI/waiting period were used in the analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: The percentage of subjects who do not experience a significant decrease in ventricular sensing amplitude from the pre-MRI/waiting period to one month post-MRI/waiting period is greater than that in the Control group minus 8%. H0: % successes MRI group ≤ % successes Control group – 8% HA: % successes MRI group > % successes Control group – 8%
analysis.p_value_desc: A priori threshold for statistical significance was 0.025.

outcome.title: System-related Complications
outcome.description: Number of subjects free of a system-related complication. The system includes the ICD and lead(s) attached to it.
outcome.population: All subjects who are successfully implanted with the Evera MRI Study System or have an implant attempt will be included in the analysis.

group.title: Implanted Subjects
group.description: All subjects who are successfully implanted with the Evera MRI Study System or have an implant attempt will be included in the analysis.

measure.title: System-related Complications
measure.description: Number of subjects free of a system-related complication. The system includes the ICD and lead(s) attached to it.
measure.population: All subjects who are successfully implanted with the Evera MRI Study System or have an implant attempt will be included in the analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: The system-related complication-free rate between the implant procedure and the one month post-MRI/waiting period is greater than 80%. H0: p ≤ 0.80 HA: p > 0.80 where p is the system-related complication-free rate between the implant procedure and 120 days (the approximate time of the one month post-MRI/waiting period visit).
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The null hypothesis will be rejected if the one-sided 95% log-log transformed lower confidence bound at 120 days post-implant calculated using Kaplan-Meier (K-M) method is greater than 80%.
analysis.p_value_desc: A priori threshold for statistical significance was 0.05.

outcome.title: RV Defibrillation Impedance
outcome.description: Number of subjects whose RV defibrillation impedance at the one-month post-MRI/waiting period visit is between 20 and 100 ohms
outcome.population: Only randomized subjects with measured RV defibrillation impedance one month post-MRI/waiting period were used in the analysis. The percentages of subjects with an RV defibrillation impedance between 20 and 100 ohms at the one month post-MRI/waiting period visit were calculated.

group.title: MRI Group
group.description: Subjects randomized to the MRI group will undergo a series of MRI scans at the MRI visit (9-12 weeks post-implant). MRI scan sequences of the head and chest regions: Non-diagnostic MRI scans

group.title: Control Group
group.description: Subjects randomized to the Control group will wait for 1 hour without having a series of MRI scans at the waiting period visit (9-12 weeks post-implant). Waiting Period Visit: Waiting period time will equate to 1 hour

measure.title: RV Defibrillation Impedance
measure.description: Number of subjects whose RV defibrillation impedance at the one-month post-MRI/waiting period visit is between 20 and 100 ohms
measure.population: Only randomized subjects with measured RV defibrillation impedance one month post-MRI/waiting period were used in the analysis. The percentages of subjects with an RV defibrillation impedance between 20 and 100 ohms at the one month post-MRI/waiting period visit were calculated.

analysis.groups_desc: The percentage of subjects who have a defibrillation impedance between 20 and 100 ohms at the one month post-MRI/waiting period visit in the MRI group is greater than that in the Control group minus 10%. H0: % successes MRI group ≤ % successes Control group – 10% HA: % successes MRI group > % successes Control group – 10% Where % successes means the % of subjects whose defibrillation impedance at the one month post-MRI/waiting period visit is between 20 and 100 ohms.
analysis.p_value_desc: A priori threshold for statistical significance was 0.05.

outcome.title: Superior Vena Cava (SVC) Defibrillation Impedance
outcome.description: Number of subjects whose SVC defibrillation impedance at the one-month post-MRI/waiting period visit is between 20 and 100 ohms
outcome.population: Only randomized subjects with measured SVC defibrillation impedance one month post-MRI/waiting period were used in the analysis. The percentages of subjects with an SVC defibrillation impedance between 20 and 100 ohms at the one month post-MRI/waiting period visit were calculated.

The percentages of subjects with an SVC defibrillation impedance between 20 and 100 ohms at the one month post-MRI/waiting period visit were calculated.

analysis.groups_desc: The percentage of subjects who have a SVC defibrillation impedance between 20 and 100 ohms at the one month post-MRI/waiting period visit in the MRI group is greater than that in the Control group minus 10%. H0: % successes MRI group ≤ % successes Control group – 10% HA: % successes MRI group > % successes Control group – 10% Where % successes means the % of subjects whose SVC defibrillation impedance at the one month post-MRI/waiting period visit is between 20 and 100 ohms.

outcome.title: Atrial Pacing Capture Threshold (APCT)
outcome.description: Number of successful patients, where success is defined as not increasing APCT by more than 0.5V from pre-MRI/waiting to one month post.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-MRI/Waiting Period visit to 1-month post-MRI/Waiting Period visit
outcome.population: To be included in the analysis, subjects in the MRI group must undergo an MRI scan and those in the Control group must complete the MRI/waiting period visit, and all the subjects must have valid APCT measurements pre-MRI/waiting period and post-MRI/waiting period.

measure.population: To be included in the analysis, subjects in the MRI group must undergo an MRI scan and those in the Control group must complete the MRI/waiting period visit, and all the subjects must have valid APCT measurements pre-MRI/waiting period and post-MRI/waiting period.

analysis.groups_desc: The percentage of subjects who experience an APCT increase less than or equal to 0.5V from the pre-MRI/waiting period to one month post-MRI/waiting period in the MRI group is greater than that in the Control group minus 10%. outcome.title: Atrial Sensing Amplitude
outcome.description: Number of successful patients, where success is defined as not decreasing atrial sensing amplitude by more than 50% from pre-MRI/waiting to one month post.
outcome.population: Only subjects with measured atrial sensing amplitude values at both the pre-MRI/waiting period and post-MRI/waiting period were used in the analysis.

H0: % successes MRI group ≤ % successes Control group – 10% HA: % successes MRI group > % successes Control group – 10%

reported_events.time_frame: The 263 randomized subjects averaged 4.5 months of implanted follow-up for a total of 97.6 years of follow-up.
reported_events.desc: There were 158 adverse events in randomized subjects.

group.title: MRI Group
group.description: Subjects randomized to the MRI group will undergo a series of MRI scans at the MRI visit (9-12 weeks post-implant). MRI scan sequences of the head and chest regions: Non-diagnostic MRI scans

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Generally, contracts allow investigators to publish study results per the protocol and publication plan. Investigators and Participating Institutions will provide any publication of Study Data generated by PI and/or Participating Institution to Medtronic for review prior to submission to determine if confidential information ("CI") is included and to check for technical correctness. Medtronic may not censor/interfere with the publication beyond the extent necessary to protect CI.
